title: Ticket #1421: CondorTest.pm's END block eats return codes.
description:
CondorTest.pm uses an END block to handle final cleanup. However, the cleanup process can call various functions that change $? (`backticks` or system()). The state of $? at the end of the block is the final return code for the program. In this particular example a chain of cleanup calls leads to CondorPersonal::KillDaemonPids which calls `condor_config_val log`. That returns 0. However, if we are trying to die(), we absolutely do not want to return 0. This causes tests to succeed that should have failed.

Credit to Will McCardell for finding the bug.
